name: A Powerful New Visual Programming System: Lambda Express
description: Lambda Express is a new visual programming system developed at ETH Zurich that makes it easy to create data-driven applications with user interfaces. Join us for the first public demonstration of the system and become an early adopter!

name: Agda2Hs
description: Agda2hs is a tool for producing verified and readable Haskell code by extracting it from a (lightly annotated) Agda program.

name: Amazonka
description: The Amazonka generator needs some serious rework to cope with modern AWS service definitions.

name: Apple array system/compiler
description: A compiler and type system

name: cabal hacking
description: Cabal is a system for building and packaging Haskell code. It has accumulated many features but everybody still wants it to do something more. I will guide participants through the codebase and help get them started on their favourite new feature.

name: Copilot Realtime Programming Language
description: Copilot is a realtime programming language and Runtime Verification framework that allows users to write concise programs in a simple but powerful way using a stream-based approach. Programs can be interpreted for testing, or translated to C99 code to be incorporated in a project, or as a standalone application. The C99 backend ensures us that the output is constant in memory and time, making it suitable for systems with hard realtime requirements.

name: Exact Print Annotations
description: The infrastructure in GHC to allow changing the AST and emitting changed source code. With original formatting, comments, etc

name: Flora.pm – A meta-index for the Haskell package ecosystem
description: Flora gathers packages from across the ecosystem and aims to provide a unifying view, analytics, and better onboarding story for beginners.

name: GHC
description: The primary Haskell compiler

name: GHC SIMD in the NCG
description: Adding SIMD support to GHC's NCG

name: ghcup
description: GHCup is the main installer for Haskell

name: Haskell Function Graph
description: A form of "Hoogle type search" for functions that can find a sequence of composed functions that converts from one type to another. For example, searching for "lazy Text to strict ByteString" returns e.g. "text-2.0.2:Data.Text.Encoding.encodeUtf8 . text-2.0.2:Data.Text.Lazy.toStrict" and "bytestring-0.11.4.0:Data.ByteString.toStrict . text-2.0.2:Data.Text.Lazy.Encoding.encodeUtf8".

name: HaskellKatas
description: In mathematics you don't understand things. You just get used to them.

name: Identity Provider
description: Auth system similar to Zitadel or Keycloak

name: Learn Rhine FRP with type level clocks
description: You can learn how to write Functional Reactive Programs using the Rhine framework. The main author will lead you through a Koans workshop with many little problems to solve, and support you with your own Rhine project.

name: Liquid Haskell
description: A verification tool for Haskell based on SMT solvers

name: Massimult
description: Towards Functional Parallel Hardware

name: Mensam
description: A desk-booking web application. Haskell backend (servant, selda). Elm frontend (elm-ui).

name: Perspec
description: Scriptable desktop app to correct the perspective of images

name: PureScript
description: A strongly-typed language that compiles to JavaScript

name: random
description: Haskell PRNG library

name: rules_haskell: Building Haskell with Bazel
description: Bazel is an open source build system developed to support large, polyglot projects. Join this project or stop by if you would like to learn about building Haskell with Bazel, help us make it easier to get started, learn when Bazel may add value to your project, or if you're interested in contributing to rules_haskell.

name: Smos
description: A comprehensive self-management system.

name: Template Haskell
description: Teo and I want to improve the implementation of Template Haskell, with an emphasis on stability and usability. Come join us in the GHC room! There is much to do.

name: The Haskell Guide
description: Help me develop an online Haskell guide, aimed at attracting/onboarding newcomers with a background in Python or similar.

name: The philosophical theory of programming languages
description: exploring the roles of programming languages in society through the lens of semiotics

name: visie
description: command-line d3 runner

name: wxHaskell
description: command-line d3 runner
